t-sLehxwhl39KVsrmk0eOw.text: We ate Thanksgiving Dinner here 11/23/2017 1st sitting. First time ever eating out for Thanksgiving! The restaurant looks the same as it did 30 years ago, gold , glitzy and glamorus. It has been maintained well and very clean, I believe new owners bought it in the past 10 years. It was a buffet. There was a long line, had to wait about 10 min to get to the food. If they could do 2 tables of food it may be better then the last hour just have it on 1 table. Was hard for older people to stand that long and kind of hard to fill and hold 2 plates. What a treat once you got your food and ate slowly! We got a window seat! What a view! Wonderful! Right in front of the Point in Pittsburgh! We had an older gentleman for our waiter Bob, very polished, very professional but very nice. His mom lived with him and was home, I asked him to wish her Happy Thanksgiving before we left. They served the traditional fixings the mashed potatoes were real, the sweet potatoes delicious, stuffing was good too, turkey right off the bone carved in front of you, gravy good. They also had cranberries whole and breadworks breads. They had prime rib our son said it was delicious, salmon, ham, salads, fresh fruit, pasta my husband said was delicious. there were other foods but you can only eat so much!! Deserts were to die for!! All good, homemmade somewhere, fresh. Pumpkin pie, cannolis, spice cake with good not too sweet cream cheese icning and carrot cake, chocolate cake, eclairs danish, you name it they served it. Coffee, tea and soft drinks were included. It was pricey per adult but the view wow! The food delicious! The service excellent! It's ok to splurge on special occassions on excellent quality!

uhYP436Lms7WiV5czCapWA.text: My review is for their wedding venue services as I recently had my reception at the LeMont and it was truly one of the greatest days of my life.  Prices were comparable to many other locations in the area, which surprised me as I always assumed the view alone would put the venue out of my price range. From the moment I walked into the reception room, I knew it was where I'd have my reception. I love the classy, old school decor and romantic feel to the space. The views cannot be beat and as we were having a good number of out of town guests, I wanted to show off Pittsburgh!  From our first meeting with Bill, the banquet manager, I knew we would be in good hands. His years of experience are evident and he was prompt with responses. There were a number of small details we requested and he always respoded: "don't worry, I'll take care of it" (place card table set up, "his and hers" whiskey glasses that we wanted to carry in with us at our entrance) - and it all got done! We were able to drop everything off the day before and they took care of the rest; it was so stress free! The set up of our reception exceeded my expectations thanks to the LeMont staff working alongside our other vendors.  Before the reception, the bridal party was able to use the cigar room until we were introduced. We were greeted right away by Bill and a member of the waitstaff, who truly treated us like it was our special day. They brought us all drinks right away and two trays of warm appetizers - the mushroom appetizer was delicious and the men all raved about the mini beef wellingtons and bacon-wrapped scallops. We got to enjoy a good 45 minutes with our bridal party before it was time for us to be introduced; it was so nice to be able to spend that intimate time with our bridal party and gave the men time to finish their celebration cigars! Out guests had a cocktail hour during this time, which must've gone well as everyone seemed energetic for our introductions.  The rest of the evening went off without a hitch - efficient dinner service and everything tasted just as it did for our taste testing. I was very impressed considering they had a packed valentines dining service on the top floor - it felt like we had the place to ourselves! The crab cakes were delicious and I could've eaten a plate of just those! I think our guests enjoyed their food, based on many empty plates. We stopped the bar during dinner and served their house wine instead, which the waitstaff were very prompt in refilling for our thirsty guests ;)  The dance floor was the perfect size and I was so pleased with how many guests were enjoying themselves! The downstairs reception area has a separate bar and sitting area, where we also set up a photo booth and our cookie tables, so our non-dancing guests were able to hang out there and talk. Even with close to 200 guests, I did not feel the space was overcrowded. My one concern with having my reception at the LeMont was that it may be a little "stuffy" but it was anything but that - we even extended the reception by an hour because our guests were having so much fun! We are still receiving compliments over a week later!  I could not have imagined a more perfect reception and cannot thank the staff of the LeMont enough for their kindness.

MwEZUWuDb7Qcd8XjA__EzA.text: Our group of 4 was seated 40 minutes later than our reservation without an apology from anyone. -ya3Iw3zwUedIo6Kgw9OHA.text: I have nothing but fond memories with friends and family dining at the Le Mont over the years. e2CAfJbOiqBvcTdb2bSNVA.text: My daughter had her wedding reception at the LeMont on November 11th.  When we were planning her wedding we looked at a number of venues throughout the city of Pittsburgh.  We finally decided upon the LeMont and I have no regrets.   Bill Laughlin and his staff are absolutely wonderful.  They are so supportive and flexible.  Pricing is not as bad as you would think.  I truly believe that they are the best bargain in the city with the BEST QUALITY. Leading up to the wedding celebration, Bill and his staff were so responsive to our questions and answered them promptly. The day before the wedding we delivered a number of items to be displayed along with over 3000 cookies.  Bill and his staff did not even blink an eye.  They said not to worry and that everything would be ready when we arrived on Saturday.  THEY WERE RIGHT!!! That evening the celebration went off without a hitch.  They food was well prepared and served hot to the 199 guests in attendance.  The hors d'oeuvres were a delight. Our guests were very complimentary.   The view is also a wonderful extra.   If you are considering the LeMont for any type of event you SHOULD make your reservation NOW.  If you go any other place you are going to pay too much and not get a good return on your investment.  Bill and his staff look at each event as if it's their own family event.   Pittsburgh wake up, this is THE PLACE to hold a wedding reception or any other special event. John G.

XkF6xYmVbuEfW2qJupNrog.text: You are paying for the view.  It is breathtaking.  The decor is old-school and dated. The service is fair - not terrible, but not worth the price.  The food is ehhhh - not the worst I've had, but no where near what you would expect for the price point.  Recently here for an event.  The salad was extraordinarily overdressed with a balsamic dressing.  The main course was a filet. These might have been the biggest filets I have ever seen.  They were cooked perfectly, much to my surprise (banquet beef is usually overdone).  It was served with a bearnaise sauce that we passed around the table. I should've passed on the sauce- it had little flavor.  The steak also lacked seasoning and was under (or maybe not at all) salted.  The sides were carrots (cooked nicely- cooked through but still maintained some firmness), green beans, and some roasted potatoes (would have been nice if they had some more seasoning or sauce).   Be forewarned, valet parking is $6. A little steep, in my opinion, but Mt. Washington parking can be tricky.  The prices at the bar weren't outrageous- charged me $1.50 for a diet coke.

6W-4l-72_10vfVpVfgRjdw.text: I've lived in the neighborhood for a long time but never ate at the Le Mont because I've always heard mediocre reviews of the food. Several friends and I went this week for the winter tasting menu, a 3 course meal for $30.  The entree options for the tasting menu were diverse, which was great for a large group containing a few picky eaters. Unfortunately, none of us enjoyed our food or experience enough to go back again.   After reviewing the wine menu I asked the waiter to tell about a Riesling and a Pinot Noir on the menu. He started to describe the difference between Rieslings and Pinots in general, which is common knowledge I didn't need to be told. I was hoping for specific information about the wines so I could pick the best wine for the table. He should have admitted he didn't know about the wines and deferred immediately to the sommelier.  The bread was served warm and everyone was OK with their first course of soup or salad. However, we all agreed, the entrees were bland, as if the chef didn't know how to properly salt the food when cooking.   Dinner service was not as good as I expected for an upscale restaurant. My friend's wine glass was spotted and my soup spoon was dirty, and utensils were not cleared between courses. For example, my salad fork should have been taken when I ordered soup as a first course or, at least, before dinner was served. The cocktail menu was also left at the table until dessert, even though we were all drinking wine.   For dessert, 3 of us ordered the pecan ball, a Pittsburgh classic. It was served too cold to dig a spoon in to and we had to all wait about 10 minutes for it to warm to a reasonable temperature. At a nice restaurant, I expect food to be served at the appropriate temperature.  I'm glad I went once because now I know that I haven't been missing anything.

eEXQRblFm4z1Ey4PeD654w.text: Came here after a long day at the NPC North American Championships (bodybuilding competition) as a triple date.  All three couples got the chateaubriand for two along with a variety or appetizers and different desserts.  The ambiance, food and service are AMAZING!  I am definitely a fan.  The place is upscale and formal, so lean towards the side of caution and dress either dress casual or formal with a jacket.  The venue is beautifully decorated with a stellar view both inside and outside of Pittsburgh.  There was a live band the night my partner and I were there with friends.  As per the food, from the appetizers to dessert, everything was perfect and down to the dot!  The serving size for appetizers are fair and entrees are generous.  For anyone seeking an intimate night with a loved one, Le Mont is definitely a place to consider.

zOr7nLyU-jqqKMz8QStguQ.text: I am glad that we went here for restaurant week because I would be very upset if we spent the money they ask for on the regular menu for such mediocre food. 8C0uHWZGYJWFa9SOf09XTw.text: The ambiance of this place really sets the tone for a great gastronomic experience. The tall ceilings, crown moulding, beautiful chandeliers and opulent environment was just beautiful. The prix fix menu was very generous for the price point. The cocktail menu was great. The cucumber martini was delicious and satisfying. The veal roulade was beautiful. The seafood it was filled with was impressive but a bit poorly executed. Several of the shellfish were not prepped well. For instance the shrimp still had shells on. I wouldn't expect to find that in a roulade. The flavor was good. The roasted pepper tomato soup was delicious. The Caesar salad was perfect! The rib eye was cooked one level higher than what I ordered but was still very tender and juicy. If ordering steak, order one level less cooked than what you fancy and you will get what you want. The fruit/vinegar compote on top of the steak was absolutely unnecessary. It totally violated the beauty of that steak. On its own, it was a delicious accompaniment but smothering the steak with it was just wrong. The table side foster dessert was a great display of showmanship on the part of our waitress who was also very good. Overall this was a memorable experience and I definitely will consider coming back here the next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

7d_ptsLp8ASkxl1LSad7oA.text: We had something to celebrate so where else would we go in Pittsburgh? The atmosphere lends to the celebration and made my sister feel so special for graduating college. It's the perfect place to go to welcome her to the adult world. But my 17-month old son wasn't out of place, which isn't what I expected! The staff was very friendly to him and there was a changing table in the bathroom for him, plus a high chair.   I had the veal and shrimp Romano piccata and it was delicious. The rest of the party had the filet mignon and one person had the crab cakes. Everyone loved their meals. I also had the table side ceased salad which felt decadent. And speaking of, the carrot cake for dessert was a perfect end to my meal.   I was happy that we were seated by the window bc duh, that's what we were there for. The view was just out of this world, of course.   I do wish the valet pulled right up to the door at the end of the night. This might seem stupid to complain, but why should I cross the street to get the car as it pulls out of the parking lot? I could have done that myself without paying $6 + tip.
